Welcome to my page!
I am Mohammad Imrul Jubair. I completed my MSc in Computer Science from the University of Calgary, Canada under the supervision of Dr. Usman R. Alim. I worked as a research assistant in Visualization and Graphics Group (VISAGG) at Graphics Jungle Lab. I completed my BSc in Computer Science and Information Technology from the Islamic University of Technology, Dhaka.


Teaching

I worked as a teaching assistant at University of Calgary from Fall 2014 to Winter 2016. I TA'd programming with python under the instruction of Ben Stephenson and Nelson Wong. Currently, I am working as a faculty member in Computer Science and Engineering at Ahasanullah University of Science and Technology, Bangladesh. See my lecture slides.

Research

I have interest in Visualization, Graphics and Computer Vision. In my MSc research, I collaborated with the German Climate Computing Centre and developed a technique for efficient multiresolution visualization of climate data. For more details please have a look at my thesis (and slides).


I have research experiences in Image Processing and Computer Vision since my undergrad. One of my ongoing projects is - Bangladeshi sign language detection using neural networks. I am mentoring a group of my students to work on this project and to build a dataset called - BdSLimset.



Some of my selected publications are listed below. You can also visit my Google Scholar page.

  1. Hoque O., Jubair M. I., Islam M. S., Akash A. & Paulson A., “Real Time Bangladeshi Sign Language Detection using Faster R-CNN”, (Submitted), International Conference on Innovation in Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, 2018.
  2. Jubair M. I., Alim U., Röber N., Clyne J. & Mahdavi-Amiri A., “Icosahedral Maps for a Multiresolution Representation of Earth Data” , 21st International Symposium on Vision, Modeling and Visualization, Bayreuth, 2016.
  3. Jubair M. I., Alim U., Röber N., Clyne J., Mahdavi-Amiri A. & Samavati. F., “Multiresolution Visualization of Digital Earth Data via Hexagonal Box Spline Wavelets”, (Poster), IEEE Scientific Visualization Conference, Chicago, 2015.
  4. Jubair M. I. & Banik P., “A Technique to Detect Books from Library Bookshelf Image”, IEEE 9th International Conference on Computational Cybernetics, Hungary, 2013.
